titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Donna Santisi collection of ephemera LSC.2408
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jasmine Larkin, 2022.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2023 February 17.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: This record is made available under an Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication Creative Commons license.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-26 14:40:26 -0700.

did.abstract: Donna Santisi was a photographer and documentarian of the Los Angeles punk scene from 1976-1980. This collection is primarily comprised of punk rock ephemera created to document the Los Angeles punk scene between 1973-2017.
did.physloc: Held at UCLA Library Special Collections. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Unprocessed collection. Material is unavailable for access. Please see LSC's Access to Unprocessed Collections Policy for more information about levels of discovery and access of special collections materials and registering interest in unprocessed collections.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: Audio materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Donna Santisi collection of ephemera (Collection 2408). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Donna Santisi was a photographer and documentarian of the Los Angeles punk scene from 1976-1980. She published Ask the Angels, a book of her black and white photographs documenting this scene in 1978 which became a "cult classic" and features essays by Alice Bag, Trudie, Exene Cervenka, Brendan Mullen, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection contains publications which published Santisi's photographs. In addition to these publications which Santisi collected, the collection also includes ephemera she saved such as ticket stubs to shows, back stage passes, flyers, correspondence, buttons, posters, invoices, several books, a scrapbook, a Runaways scarf, and two audiocassettes.
This collection is primarily comprised of punk rock ephemera created to document the Los Angeles punk scene between 1973-2017. The bulk of the materials were created between 1975 and 1980.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Unprocessed collection. Material is unavailable for access. Please see LSC's Access to Unprocessed Collections Policy for more information about levels of discovery and access of special collections materials and registering interest in unprocessed collections.
